About.Name: Anthony Mao
About.AboutText:
Hi, I am Anthony Mao. I am a computer science student pursuing my undergraduate degree at Seattle Pacific University, expected graduation June 2026.

I thrive in collaborative environments where I can contribute my expertise and learn from my peers.

Beyond the classroom, I actively engage in projects that strengthen my technical skills and teamwork abilities. I am dedicated to continuous learning and exploring new technologies to expand my expertise.

Experience.ExperienceText:
Over the summer of 2025, I completed an internship at Prestige Stem Academy, a private educational institution specializing in Honors, AP, and IB instruction, academic enrichment, and college counseling.

Role: IT Support Intern
  • Set up classroom technology (TVs, computers, printers, quiz buzzers)
  • Scanned and digitized class documents
  • Managed student attendance and performance via registration system
  • Supported Canvas and school account setup under IT supervision
Experience.EducationText: Currently pursuing my undergraduate degree in Computer Science at Seattle Pacific University, with coursework focused on software engineering, algorithms, and database systems.
Experience.EmploymentText: Provided technical support for classroom technology, digitized documents, and assisted with IT systems setup.
Experience.SkillsText: Proficient in programming languages such as C++, SQL, and Python. Experienced in backend development, database integration, and technical support.

Project1.Title: TrayMate Senior Software Engineering Project
Project1.Desc:
TrayMate is a smart, AI-powered meal management system designed for care facilities. It automates meal suggestions and provides a simple ordering interface for residents, particularly those with special dietary needs.

Team Project: Collaborated with classmates.
My Role: Backend developer, responsible for database integration and API design.

Project2.Title: Personal Portfolio Website
Project2.Desc: An individual project where I designed and deployed my personal portfolio using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Hosted on GitHub Pages to showcase my academic and professional work.
